name: civo
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing Civo cloud resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`civo` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/civo/terraform-provider-civo).

provider.description:
The provider type for the civo package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

name.description: A fully qualified domain name
A fully qualified domain name

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering DnsDomainName resources.

name.description: A fully qualified domain name

The portion before the domain name (e.g. www) or an @ for the apex/root domain (you cannot use an A record with an
amex/root domain)

priority.description: Useful for MX records only, the priority mail should be attempted it (defaults to 10)

ttl.description:
How long caching DNS servers should cache this record for, in seconds (the minimum is 600 and the default if unspecified
is 600)

type.description: The choice of RR type from a, cname, mx or txt

value.description: The IP address (A or MX), hostname (CNAME or MX) or text value (TXT) to serve for this record

The portion before the domain name (e.g. www) or an @ for the apex/root domain (you cannot use an A record with an
amex/root domain)

priority.description: Useful for MX records only, the priority mail should be attempted it (defaults to 10)

ttl.description:
How long caching DNS servers should cache this record for, in seconds (the minimum is 600 and the default if unspecified
is 600)

type.description: The choice of RR type from a, cname, mx or txt

value.description: The IP address (A or MX), hostname (CNAME or MX) or text value (TXT) to serve for this record

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering Firewall resources.

cidrs.description:
The IP address of the other end (i.e. not your instance) to affect, or a valid network CIDR (defaults to being globally
applied, i.e. 0.0.0.0/0)

direction.description: Will this rule affect ingress traffic

endPort.description: The end of the port range (this is optional, by default it will only apply to the single port listed in start_port)

label.description: A string that will be the displayed name/reference for this rule (optional)

protocol.description: The protocol choice from tcp, udp or icmp (the default if unspecified is tcp)

startPort.description: The start of the port range to configure for this rule (or the single port if required)

cidrs.description:
The IP address of the other end (i.e. not your instance) to affect, or a valid network CIDR (defaults to being globally
applied, i.e. 0.0.0.0/0)

direction.description: Will this rule affect ingress traffic

endPort.description: The end of the port range (this is optional, by default it will only apply to the single port listed in start_port)

label.description: A string that will be the displayed name/reference for this rule (optional)

protocol.description: The protocol choice from tcp, udp or icmp (the default if unspecified is tcp)

startPort.description: The start of the port range to configure for this rule (or the single port if required)

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering FirewallRule resources.

cidrs.description:
The IP address of the other end (i.e. not your instance) to affect, or a valid network CIDR (defaults to being globally
applied, i.e. 0.0.0.0/0)

direction.description: Will this rule affect ingress traffic

endPort.description: The end of the port range (this is optional, by default it will only apply to the single port listed in start_port)

label.description: A string that will be the displayed name/reference for this rule (optional)

protocol.description: The protocol choice from tcp, udp or icmp (the default if unspecified is tcp)

startPort.description: The start of the port range to configure for this rule (or the single port if required)

firewallId.description:
The ID of the firewall to use, from the current list. If left blank or not sent, the default firewall will be used (open
to all)

hostname.description: A fully qualified domain name that should be set as the instance's hostname (required)

initialUser.description:
The name of the initial user created on the server (optional; this will default to the template's default_username and
fallback to civo)

networkId.description: This must be the ID of the network from the network listing (optional; default network used when not specified)

notes.description: Add some notes to the instance

publicIpRequiered.description: This should be either none, create or `move_ip_from:intances_id` by default is create

reverseDns.description:
A fully qualified domain name that should be used as the instance's IP's reverse DNS (optional, uses the hostname if
unspecified)

script.description:
the contents of a script that will be uploaded to /usr/local/bin/civo-user-init-script on your instance,
read/write/executable only by root and then will be executed at the end of the cloud initialization

size.description: The name of the size, from the current list, e.g. g2.small (required)

sshkeyId.description:
The ID of an already uploaded SSH public key to use for login to the default user (optional; if one isn't provided a
random password will be set and returned in the initial_password field)

tags.description: An optional list of tags, represented as a key, value pair

template.description: The ID for the template to use to build the instance

applications.description:
a comma separated list of applications to install.Spaces within application names are fine, but shouldn't be either side
of the comma.If you want to remove a default installed application, prefix it with a '-', e.g. -traefik.

kubernetesVersion.description: the version of k3s to install (optional, the default is currently the latest available)

name.description: a name for your cluster, must be unique within your account (required)

numTargetNodes.description: the number of instances to create (optional, the default at the time of writing is 3)

tags.description: a space separated list of tags, to be used freely as required (optional)

targetNodesSize.description: the size of each node (optional, the default is currently g2.small)

backends.description: a list of backend instances, each containing an instance_id, protocol (http or https) and port

failTimeout.description: how long to wait in seconds before determining a backend has failed, defaults to 30

healthCheckPath.description: what URL should be used on the backends to determine if it's OK (2xx/3xx status), defaults to /

hostname.description:
the hostname to receive traffic for, e.g. www.example.com (optional: sets hostname to loadbalancer-uuid.civo.com if
blank)

ignoreInvalidBackendTls.description: should self-signed/invalid certificates be ignored from the backend servers, defaults to true

maxConns.description: how many concurrent connections can each backend handle, defaults to 10

maxRequestSize.description: the size in megabytes of the maximum request content that will be accepted, defaults to 20

policy.description:
one of: least_conn (sends new requests to the least busy server), random (sends new requests to a random backend),
round_robin (sends new requests to the next backend in order), ip_hash (sends requests from a given IP address to the
same backend), default is random

port.description:
you can listen on any port, the default is 80 to match the default protocol of http,if not you must specify it here
(commonly 80 for HTTP or 443 for HTTPS)

protocol.description: either http or https. If you specify https then you must also provide the next two fields, the default is http

tlsCertificate.description: if your protocol is https then you should send the TLS certificate in Base64-encoded PEM format

tlsKey.description: if your protocol is https then you should send the TLS private key in Base64-encoded PEM format

cronTiming.description:
If a valid cron string is passed, the snapshot will be saved as an automated snapshot,continuing to automatically update
based on the schedule of the cron sequence provided.The default is nil meaning the snapshot will be saved as a one-off
snapshot.

instanceId.description: The ID of the instance to snapshot

name.description: This is a unqiue, alphanumerical, short, human readable code for the snapshot

safe.description:
If true the instance will be shut down during the snapshot to ensure all filesare in a consistent state (e.g. database
tables aren't in the middle of being optimisedand hence risking corruption). The default is false so you experience no
interruptionof service, but a small risk of corruption.

cloudConfig.description:
Commonly referred to as 'user-data', this is a customisation script that is run afterthe instance is first booted. We
recommend using cloud-config as it's a great distribution-agnosticway of configuring cloud servers. If you put
$INITIAL_USER in your script, this will automaticallybe replaced by the initial user chosen when creating the instance,
$INITIAL_PASSWORD will bereplaced with the random password generated by the system, $HOSTNAME is the fully
qualifieddomain name of the instance and $SSH_KEY will be the content of the SSH public key.(this is technically
optional, but you won't really be able to use instances without it -see our learn guide on templates for more
information)

code.description: This is a unqiue, alphanumerical, short, human readable code for the template (required).

defaultUsername.description: The default username to suggest that the user creates (optional: defaults to civo).

description.description: A multi-line description of the template, in Markdown format (optional).

imageId.description:
This is the Image ID of any default template or the ID of another template,either owned by you or global (optional; but
must be specified if no volume_id is specified).

name.description: This is a short human readable name for the template (optional).

shortDescription.description: A one line description of the template (optional)

volumeId.description:
This is the ID of a bootable volume, either owned by you or global(optional; but must be specified if no image_id is
specified).

optional, but you won't really be able to use instances without it -see our learn guide on templates for more

nodejs.packageDescription: A Pulumi package for creating and managing Civo cloud resources.
nodejs.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/civo/terraform-provider-civo)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi/pulumi-civo` repo](https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-civo/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`civo/terraform-provider-civo` repo](https://github.com/civo/terraform-provider-civo/issues).
